intro: Telinaria sericea, commonly known as the silverleaf telinaria, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its small, silver-gray leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Telinaria sericea is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
